reviews.review:
This game in a nutshell:
Catch BIG HONKERS
Upgrade your gear with the money you get from this
Catch EVEN BIGGER HONKERS
Get a boat and better gear
Catch ABSOLUTELY MASSIVE HONKERS
Buy whatever your heart desires

- Caught plenty of honkers
- 10/10 would play again

catch some big friggin honkers

compared to other fishing games i've played (such as fishing planet, sega bass pro fishing, and Sonic Adventure Big the Cat sections), this one is definitely the best, it's a little confusing at first but once you get a feel for the game you'll be catching non-stop honkers.

the levelling system seems pretty decent, the controls are about as perfect as needed for a fishing game, and the areas are all pretty fun to fish in and feel pretty realistic.

obviously, this being an early access game, my only "negative" about the game will be fixed I'm sure. The negative is that there seems to be very few types of fish, specifically 2 or 3 groups / clusters of fish, which changes based on your location, bass / carp in the level 1 lake area, or mahi / marlin type fish in the level 9 ocean area, for example.

overall though, very relaxing game with a nice atmosphere, and I'm already looking forward to catching some big honkers with the later level skills
Just caught a fat honker 10/10 must buy

I' ve  been playing this for a few weeks now and i have to say i really like it as it has devoloped over the weeks. The only gripes i have are that it is to easy to level up and the fish after the initial run lose all their fight and you  can just wind them in without much problem. I played this one night a couple of weeks back and every fish i hooked fought right to the bitter end and it was really exciting and quite exhillarating when you actually landed a fish , the following night it was back to the same hook, run, and reel it in. It is ok the way it is for what it is but if the fish had a bit more fight in them it woul be a real gem.      
" PLEASE TWEEK THE FISH"

A really nice, relaxing, fun fishing game. It's kind of in between a simulator and an arcade game. I've had it for a while and initially I didn't like it due to the inventory/store interface, but the very active Devs have fixed that. Overall a very enjoyable game.

This is a great fishing game, it's very realistic and it has tons of different options for rods and lures and all different sorts of things to buy. It's fairly relaxing and looks great.

8/10

I'm wary of Early Access games after a poor experience previously.

This game is amazing! Most other publishers would kill it with pay-to-play tactics; making you pay for lures, rods, reels, licenses, etc. with real money. This is a buy it once and own it fishing game with RPG additions.

This dev releases regular (weekly or twice weekly) updates fixing bugs and adding features. I will admit, it's not perfect. The menu is drastically unoptimized (huge frame drop). BUT, I've not had it crash yet, even with the latest released features. You do need to have a fairly strong gaming system to play it.

Ice fishing, lakes, rivers, boats, fly fishing, whatever your little heart desires, and if it's not here, the dev is probably planning on adding it. I'm definitely not a fishing game expert, but I've played a few over my nearly 30 years playing computer and console games. This is the best I've played yet.

This game as come a long way, but now it is for me way better then fishing planet. i'll say one because the grinding is not as intense an two the fish size vary within the same lake, if i have better gear i can catch a 40 lbs rainboux trout in the same lake, i feel i'm not force to grind for hours to get a unique or a 1 lbs more heavy than the rest a the usual to be call a trophy, in this game a trophy is a big fish, and it is not what is fishing is about? not knowing what is gonna strike your lure? i was a bit uncertain at first with the mechanics of the game, witch fishing planet as really done a good job on that part, but i kept trying an now i feel that this game is way more realistic as when it comes to fighting the fish, you pull...retrieve. it's awesome and for the price it's really worth it. I really recommend this game!

Finally a really good arcade fishing simulator that isn't programmed to subtley frustrate you into pooring money into a "pay to win' or "pay to ease the pain we programmed into this game for you" bs system like some others we won't mention... ;) This game has improved greatly since it's initial early access launch! Again, unlike some other EA titles out there that take years to see quality updates. Can't wait to see what more these guys add to an already overall - better than good - experience.

I have been playing Russian fishing 4 and have been loving it apart from the pay to win aspect but that's what you get when games are free. Ultimate Fishing Simulator is like a breath of fresh air with nice content, decent graphics and pretty good mechanics. My first fish was a 2.2kg brown trout and gave a nice little fight and if I where to compare games then I put about 60 hours of time into Russian fishing before I caught a fish of this size so it felt great ! You can see other players and you can interact via the chat box and the choice of fishing styles really adds longevity to the game. Well done Lads, you have a made a nice game.

- First fishing game I bought! and I like it

× Good variety of fish.
× Different fishing locations. 
× Decent learning curve.
× The music streaming built in is genius!
× Underwater cam is great
× Community is friendly & helpful
love this game please add more fish and bigger fish. only complaint i feel like it takes a little while to earn enough to make enough cash but i love it overall.
reviews.developer_response:
Hello!
Thank you for your feedback. Earnings will be balanced this month :)

reviews.review:
Almost an all-encompassing fishing simulator, including easier gameplay options for new players.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cq3cna_L7YY 
== QUICK REVIEW ==
[table]
[tr][th]PERFORMANCE[/th][td]A[/td][/tr]
[tr][th]GRAPHICS[/th][td]B+[/td][/tr]
[tr][th]CONTENT AND MODS[/th][td]B+[/td][/tr]
 [tr][th]VALUE FOR MONEY[/th][td]B+[/td][/tr]
[tr][th]DEPTH[/th][td]B+[/td][/tr]
 [tr][th]REALISM[/th][td]B+[/td][/tr]
[tr][th]UI[/th][td]B+[/td][/tr]
[tr][th]CUSTOMISATION[/th][td]C[/td][/tr]
[tr][th]AUDIO[/th][td]C[/td][/tr]
[tr][th][/th][td][/td][/tr]
[tr][th]OVERALL[/th][td]B+[/td][/tr]
[/table]

== PRO ==
- Each of the 9 included Fisheries look nice; especially water effects.
- Solid 120FPS performance.
- Lots of equipment to choose from work with (some branded).
- Boats, Ice fishing, Fly Fishing (coming).
- It has a Trophy Room (really nice touch).
- Supports Keyboard & Mouse and Controller equally well.
- Good selection of Fish.
- Built in Fishery Generator tool.
- Feels natural to play.
- Excellent support for New player in Normal mode.

== CON ==
- No controller customisation.
- Poor Multi Player Approach (Could be fully functioning).
- A little too easy…even when on Realism Mode.
- Fisheries are good, could be bigger.
 - No Steam Workshop support.

== OVERVIEW ==
A small company has delivered big time on this one…prob best fishing game ATM but has a few too many limitations to be the best ever.

MP needs fleshing out, and by doing that the game would become a really long term solid competitor.

I really like and appreciate the Normal/Realistic approach, but Realistic doesn’t do enough and restricts some features it perhaps shouldn’t.

Overall, this is a great fishing experience and I have no doubt you will enjoy it.

== What I’d Like to See ==
-	Full MP.
-	More realism.
-	Controller configuration.

It's early access and overpriced for the stage it's at. At it's current stage it'd be pushing to say it's worth $5. Graphics and animations are at the stage of a 2005 game. Fish fighting mechanics are very basic and forgiving, they don't put any burst of speed on, get a 2nd wind or jump. I figured it would be overpriced and still decided to give it a shot since it didn't seem to have all those addons that modern fishing games seem to milk money from. Fortunately it has none of that, but I don't see it being worth it's current price for at least another 2 years. The fact that fish will swim from 10m off straight to the bait in the exact same animation and eat it immediately, removes any sort of excitement or joy from the game. Fish will never show interest in your bait they'll only swim straight up and eat it in the exact same manner every time, they'll also only ever start eating after a set period of time has past. Rod control is non-existent apart from the lift rod button. Imparting the slightest lure action that is currently possible is apparently coded to stop the fish biting the lure. The only recognised luring technique is straight reeling it in. As far as I can tell there is no greater chance of the fish taking your lure than it is some bait. So since you can keep your bait near the fish much more easily than a lure it's pretty much 10x more effective just to stick to bait. I haven't noticed any difference in feeding patterns. There are 10+ year old fishing games that are better than this.

This is by far the best fishing game out there. I got this for my 5 year old and now Im playing it more than he is. Its easy enough for him to play it and move around in the menu and its also complicated enough to keep a grown man entertaned. Really enjoying the chat with other function and seeing the spots they are fishing at...

Well... the net hardly works. Game ruined.

Update the net so it works when you go to get the fish.
reviews.developer_response:
Hi,
Could you send a bug report or mail to help@ultimate-games.com with screenshot and better description of this problem?

reviews.review: I Really wanted to play this game and I did purchase it for around 15 minutes then refunded. I have a 290x and fx-8350 and couldn't get the game to run over 60 fps (144 was the target) Sadly I won't be playing this game anytime soon but from what I played it did seem enjoyable... Also I couldn't catch a fish but that's probably because I'm a moron.
